feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial application that computes material, crew, overhead, and profit with concrete examples and a final project cost, satisfying the criterion. The DISCOVER and IMPLEMENT evidence show intent and functioning calculations, while REFLECT confirms testing and awareness of limitations.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission describes a Colab script that performs formulaic cost calculations but contains no evidence of AI methods, models, or AI-driven features; the DRIVER stages show planning, building, and reflecting on a non-AI script. Therefore the criterion "Integrate AI" is not met.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I used Google Google Colab and made a, um, script that will calculate concrete, price of concrete, um, overhead, percent that you want to make on it."
"So then this will spit out everything for me, calculate everything for me."

"So as you can see, um everything listed out here. Concrete formwork, crew overhead, profit estimates. 16 by 16 with the depth of 6 in. You'll need approximately 4.74 yards ... total project cost including profit is $28,994."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student identified a concrete-costing financial need and target users (foremen, superintendents, subcontractors).  
Implement: student built and ran a Colab script that produces detailed cost breakdowns and totals.  
Reflect: student tested the tool with a foreman, noted limitations (formwork area calculation) and iterated mentally/worked around it.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial application that computes material, crew, overhead, and profit with concrete examples and a final project cost, satisfying the criterion. The DISCOVER and IMPLEMENT evidence show intent and functioning calculations, while REFLECT confirms testing and awareness of limitations.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I used Google Google Colab and made a, um, script that will calculate concrete, price of concrete"
"So then this will spit out everything for me, calculate everything for me."
"The only hard thing about this project or about me using this was um I understand Colab very well. I tried it once or twice, and I couldn't figure out um really how to understand that."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: student describes the idea to build a Colab script (conceptualization).
- Implement: student reports a scripted tool that performs deterministic calculations (implementation).
- Reflect: student reflects on using Colab but does not mention any AI models, ML techniques, or AI-driven features (reflection).
criteria.reasoning: The submission describes a Colab script that performs formulaic cost calculations but contains no evidence of AI methods, models, or AI-driven features; the DRIVER stages show planning, building, and reflecting on a non-AI script. Therefore the criterion "Integrate AI" is not met.
